channels.summary: Channel shared OSINT-related journalism, data resources for academic research, and programmes/labs focused on open-source investigations, plus brief discussion on ethics and reaching out to practitioners.

highlights.title: Reuters Institute article on OSINT in Israel–Hamas/Israel–Gaza war
highlights.details: Article discusses how the Israel–Hamas war showcases both the strengths and limitations of open-source reporting, useful for teaching OSINT and media literacy in academic settings.

highlights.title: AI agent that evades online survey detection
highlights.details: 404 Media reports on a research project where an AI agent successfully completed and evaded detection in online scientific surveys 99.8% of the time, raising concerns about data integrity and the reliability of survey-based research.

highlights.title: ProPublica generic drug manufacturing dataset (Rx Inspector)
highlights.details: ProPublica released data enabling researchers to study the quality and supply chains of generic drugs, bypassing traditional access barriers and facilitating large-scale academic work on pharmaceutical manufacturing.

highlights.title: Utrecht Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab
highlights.details: University of Utrecht lab focused on open-source investigations in support of global justice and accountability, relevant for students and scholars interested in legal/justice applications of OSINT.

highlights.title: Queen’s Belfast GLAN programme on global legal action
highlights.details: Program at Queen’s University Belfast (School of Law) associated with the Global Legal Action Network, of interest to those combining law, human rights, and open-source investigations.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Stage Talk RSS feed for academic use
highlights.details: RSS feed providing audio recordings of Bellingcat Stage Talks, which can be used as teaching content or case studies in OSINT-focused courses.

highlights.title: Opinion and criticism on death voyeurism in media
highlights.details: Shared New York Times and Guardian articles exploring ethical issues around ‘moment-of-death’ videos and war/violence photography, useful for academic discussions on media ethics and trauma.

highlights.title: Terence Tao confirms suspension of his research
highlights.details: Member verified rumors about Fields Medalist Terence Tao’s research being suspended by linking to Tao’s own Mathstodon post, providing a primary-source confirmation for an ongoing academic-freedom story.

mentions: Open Source Global Justice Investigations Lab

channels.summary: Server-wide announcements promoted recent Bellingcat investigations, Stage Talks, open-source challenges, and community/administrative updates (including content moderation changes around sensitive topics).

highlights.title: Stage Talk on the Open Source Munitions Portal
highlights.details: Recording of a Stage Talk discussing the Open Source Munitions Portal, focusing on identifying and tracking munitions via open sources, now available as a podcast episode.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Open Source Challenge puzzles
highlights.details: Ongoing release of OSINT puzzles at challenge.bellingcat.com, with encouragement for members to attempt them and share methods, reinforcing practical skills in open-source investigations.

highlights.title: Investigation into ICE raids and use of force in Illinois
highlights.details: Bellingcat and Evident Media’s investigation into U.S. immigration raids in Illinois, examining alleged abuses and use of force, shared with Discord community for context and feedback.

highlights.title: Harm-reduction approach to Epstein-related discussion
highlights.details: Announcement that Epstein-related discussion has been moved into a dedicated, mute-able forum thread to reduce harm and allow members to avoid triggering content while keeping the space for research.

highlights.title: Call for wildlife and environment investigations using OSINT
highlights.details: Bellingcat invited submissions of wildlife and environmental investigations based on open-source methods, specifying that work must meet rigorous investigative journalism and fact-checking standards.

channels.summary: Light but substantive activity, referencing OSINT geolocation challenges in China and Myanmar.

highlights.title: Airship/balloon infrastructure sites in remote China
highlights.details: User notes interesting hangar and mooring pole infrastructure for airships/balloons in remote Chinese locations, suggesting potential targets for further satellite/image-based geolocation work.

highlights.title: Geolocation challenge: comparing Myanmar offshore islands
highlights.details: Shared link to a previous Discord post inviting users to compare two islands off Myanmar’s coast, serving as a practical geolocation exercise.

channels.summary: Channel reported on recent museum thefts, shared major archival resources for WWII-era claims, and discussed access strategies for out-of-print art-crime literature.

highlights.title: Theft at Zilvermuseum Doesburg in the Netherlands
highlights.details: Blogpost covering a major theft of approximately 300 silver pieces from the Zilvermuseum in Doesburg, adding to the pattern of theft-for-commodification targeting museums.

highlights.title: Digitized Nuremberg Trials collection from Harvard Law School Library
highlights.details: Harvard Law School Library released a fully searchable, digitized collection of evidentiary documents and trial transcripts from all 13 Nuremberg Trials, a major primary-source resource for WWII-era provenance and restitution research.

highlights.title: Language access and coverage gaps in heritage recovery cases
highlights.details: Member highlighted how heritage recovery stories often lack multilingual coverage and mentioned a high-profile Spanish recovery of two bronze toddlers on loan to the Met, arguing for more English-language write-ups.

highlights.title: Accessing drafts of out-of-print art-crime books
highlights.details: Practical tip suggesting that financially constrained researchers can sometimes request writer’s drafts from authors of out-of-print books, provided contracts allow sharing.

highlights.title: BBC article on recent art/heritage development
highlights.details: BBC News link shared, likely relating to art crime or heritage issues (exact case not summarized in the message).

channels.summary: Shared major regional news on high-profile economic crime and press-freedom cases involving Cambodia, China, and Hong Kong.

highlights.title: Deportation of Cambodian tycoon Chen Zhi to China
highlights.details: Article details how Chen Zhi (Vincent Chen), founder of Prince Holding Group, was deported to China amid allegations of fraud and money laundering linked to human trafficking and forced-labor ‘pig butchering’ scams.

highlights.title: Jimmy Lai sentenced to 20 years under Hong Kong national security law
highlights.details: Hong Kong Free Press report on media tycoon Jimmy Lai receiving a 20-year sentence after a national security conviction, a key press-freedom case in the region.

channels.summary: Members shared aviation OSINT tools, investigative reporting about safety/regulatory conflicts, and official crash-investigation updates.

highlights.title: TweetDeck-style interface for LiveATC feeds
highlights.details: Tutorial shows how to build a TweetDeck-like multi-column interface for LiveATC audio feeds, useful for aviation monitoring and OSINT workflows.

highlights.title: BlueSky account tracking ICE aircraft using OSINT
highlights.details: User recommended a BlueSky account that follows U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) aircraft with open-source data, potentially valuable for those tracking deportation or enforcement flights.

highlights.title: ProPublica investigation on Starship launches, FAA, and airline safety
highlights.details: Article examines how SpaceX Starship test launches and FAA decisions may affect airline safety and airspace management over Florida and the Caribbean.

highlights.title: NTSB preliminary report on UPS Flight 2976 crash
highlights.details: Link to the NTSB’s preliminary investigation page for the UPS Flight 2976 crash in Kentucky, providing official factual data for aviation safety and accident analysis.

channels.summary: Brief conceptual discussion on the terminology used for crowd-control munitions and its implications in academic literature and public discourse.

highlights.title: Debate over ‘less-lethal’ vs ‘less-than-lethal’ munitions
highlights.details: Members noted that academic literature prefers the term ‘less lethal’ because ‘less-than-lethal’ falsely implies munitions cannot kill, despite documented fatalities from so-called non-lethal projectiles.

channels.summary: Shared datasets and analyses on Central Asian military infrastructure and discussed evolving Russian military and disinformation activity in Armenia and the wider region.

highlights.title: Oxus Society visualization of Tajik military units
highlights.details: Interactive visualization of Tajikistan’s military units compiled by Oxus Society, useful for mapping and understanding regional force structure.

highlights.title: Upcoming interactive map of 620+ Uzbek military facilities
highlights.details: Member announced an almost-ready interactive product mapping over 620 military facilities across Uzbekistan, indicating a substantial forthcoming OSINT resource.

highlights.title: DFRLab report on ‘biolabs’ disinformation narrative in Armenia
highlights.details: User summarized a DFRLab report about the spread of the ‘biolabs’ conspiracy narrative from Ukraine to Armenia, including accusations involving the CDC and USAID, and concern over targeting scientific conferences.

highlights.title: Russian troop buildup in Armenia amid tensions with Azerbaijan
highlights.details: Euromaidan Press piece on accelerated Russian troop deployments in Armenia as tensions with Azerbaijan increase.

highlights.title: Clarification on Armenia–Azerbaijan peace deal terminology
highlights.details: Shared post distinguishing ‘initialing’ from ‘signing’ a peace agreement, clarifying that the sides have agreed on language but not yet fully ratified the deal.

highlights.title: NK Observer regional update
highlights.details: Link to NK Observer X/Twitter post with regional security or political developments related to the Caucasus/Central Asia (exact content not summarized in-channel).

channels.summary: Channel celebrated renewed activity by geolocators and documented a completed residential damage case in Kherson oblast with precise coordinates.

highlights.title: Geolocation of residential damage in Kozats'ke & Vesele, Kherson
highlights.details: User provided coordinates for multiple photos (e.g., 46.797151, 33.354942) matching residential locations in Kozats'ke and Vesele, Kherson, with Google Maps link and original Telegram source.

channels.summary: Short discussion critiqued overhyped ‘AI OSINT agents’ and emphasized the current limits of automation in open-source investigations.

highlights.title: Skepticism toward ‘AI OSINT agents’ and automation limits
highlights.details: Members argued that many marketed ‘AI OSINT agents’ overpromise capabilities and should generally be avoided, noting current automation is realistically limited to basic object/type detection in most investigative workflows.

channels.summary: Meta-channel highlighted Bellingcat’s tools, podcast episodes, annual report, new WhatsApp channel, and a phishing warning, alongside light community banter.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Toolkit one-year milestone
highlights.details: Reminder that the Bellingcat Toolkit is a curated, volunteer-maintained catalog of OSINT tools with use cases and reviews, marking its first anniversary.

highlights.title: Bellingcat WhatsApp updates channel
highlights.details: Announcement that Bellingcat now has a WhatsApp channel for people wishing to receive investigation updates outside of traditional social media platforms.

highlights.title: Bellingcat Annual Report 2024
highlights.details: Annual report summarizing Bellingcat’s 2024 investigations, impacts, and lessons learned, shared as a PDF.

highlights.title: Stage Talk: Mapping Central Asia’s armed forces
highlights.details: Podcast episode featuring Oxus Society’s Michael Hilliard discussing how logistics and mapping of Central Asian armed forces shape military power, with Bellingcat contributors involved.

highlights.title: Award recognition for open-source extremist identifications
highlights.details: Shared link to journalism awards recognizing Bellingcat contributors for open-source extremist identification work.

highlights.title: Phishing warning: fake Bellingcat staff emails
highlights.details: Advised members to report suspicious emails purporting to be from Bellingcat staff to contact@bellingcat.com, with a linked BlueSky post detailing the warning.

channels.summary: Discussion centered on a technically-identified LATAM bot network and an EUvsDisinfo post involving Wikipedia, with consideration of how such claims should be handled with Wikimedia bodies.

highlights.title: LATAM bot network identified via Go/Golang error signature
highlights.details: Investigator documented 70+ accounts across at least five Latin American countries that shared a distinctive Go/Golang formatting error string ("%!(EXTRA string=...)") and posted in synchronized windows, amplifying contradictory political content—a methodologically-interesting signature-based approach to bot detection.

highlights.title: EUvsDisinfo post involving Wikipedia and disinformation claims
highlights.details: Shared EUvsDisinfo BlueSky post, followed by a comment noting that if the EU has concrete evidence related to Wikipedia, it should contact Wikimedia’s Arbitration Committees and WMF directly.

channels.summary: Channel welcomed a new member focused on animal exploitation in Brazil and shared multiple tools and articles on deforestation, climate impacts, environmental monitoring, glyphosate safety, infrastructure risks, and Indigenous land rights.

highlights.title: Nusantara Atlas deforestation mapping platform
highlights.details: Interactive site visualizing deforestation in Indonesia, Malaysia, Brunei, Papua New Guinea, and Colombia, useful for environmental OSINT and monitoring land-use change.

highlights.title: Copernicus Marine Jupyter notebooks for environmental monitoring
highlights.details: Copernicus provides e-learning Jupyter notebooks on environmental monitoring and analysis, offering hands-on tutorials well-suited for OSINT practitioners working with Earth-observation data.

highlights.title: Glyphosate safety paper retracted after 25 years
highlights.details: Mastodon post highlighting that a seminal paper long used to justify glyphosate safety has been retracted due to concerns about authorship and validity, with major implications for regulatory debates.

highlights.title: Mosquitoes detected in Iceland as climate warms
highlights.details: Guardian article describing how mosquitoes have been recorded in Iceland for the first time, framed as a visible marker of climate change impacts in traditionally cold regions.

highlights.title: Sinking US dams and climate/infrastructure risk
highlights.details: Washington Post piece on U.S. dams that are physically sinking and the associated safety and climate resilience risks; an archived copy was also provided.

highlights.title: Miccosukee Tribe, Alligator Alcatraz, and blocked land-return bill
highlights.details: Grist article on how the Miccosukee Tribe blocked the controversial Alligator Alcatraz project but then faced a presidential veto blocking a bill that would have returned their land, illustrating intersections of Indigenous rights and environmental protection.

highlights.title: Video on reducing canteen carbon footprint through menu swaps
highlights.details: YouTube short reporting that swapping dishes on a canteen’s weekly menu led to a 30% reduction in carbon footprint, highlighting behavioral levers for climate mitigation.
